version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> User interface symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: An icon of a outlined sun, used when decreasingÂ the brightness of a screen.Â Appears smallerÂ than theÂ HighÂ Brightness Symbol. Dim Button was  http://emojipedia.org/low-brightness-symbol/
emoji_net_data.name: dim button

bn:00099568a: Bright and pleasant; promoting a feeling of cheer

bn:00103623a: As if shining with a brilliant light; radiant.

bn:00098857a: Emitting or reflecting light readily or in large amounts

bn:00092637v: Be bright by reflecting or casting light
To bend back (light, etc.) from a surface.

bn:00013123n: The luminous flux emitted in a given direction divided by the product of the projected area of the source element perpendicular to the direction and the solid angle containing that direction, i.e. luminous intensity divided by unit area; measured in stilbs or apostilbs
The ability of emitting or reflecting light.
The quality of being luminous; emitting or reflecting light
A measure of the amount of light radiated by a given source, such as a computer display screen.
Luminance is a photometric measure of the luminous intensity per unit area of light traveling in a given direction.
A photometric measure of the density of luminous intensity in a given direction, measured in candela per square metre (cd/m 2).
The amount of light that is emitted by a computer monitor or picture displayed on the monitor.
The amount of light coming from an object.
The state of being luminous, or a luminous object; brilliance or radiance

bn:00075151n: Summer is the warmest of the four temperate seasons, falling between spring and autumn.
The period or season of summer.
One of the four seasons, between Spring and Autumn
The warmest season of the year; in the northern hemisphere it extends from the summer solstice to the autumnal equinox
The time during the summer months.

bn:00075170n: The star that is the source of light and heat for the planets in the solar system
The Sun is the star at the center of the Solar System.
The star at the center of the Solar System, represented in astronomy and astrology by ?.
Star at the centre of the Solar System
The particular star at the centre of our solar system, from which the Earth gets light and heat.
An inhabitant of any part of the solar system of the star Sol (i.e. the Sun).
The fourth planet from Earth in the Ptolemaic geocentric cosmology
